questions.text: An In a patient diagnosed with familial hypercholesterolemia, physicians are discussing the mechanisms of cholesterol uptake in cells. Which process among the following, relevant to cholesterol transport into cells, does not typically follow saturation kinetics in its uptake?
Gap junctions are intercellular connections that

options.label: A
options.text: Primarily serve to keep cells separated and allow for transport across a tissue barrier.

options.label: B
options.text: Serve as a regulated cytoplasmic bridge for sharing of small molecules between cells.

options.label: C
options.text: Serve as a barrier to prevent protein movement within the cellular membrane.

options.label: D
options.text: Are cellular components for constitutive exocytosis that occurs between adjacent cells

questions.correct_answer: B. Serve as a regulated cytoplasmic bridge for sharing of small molecules between cells.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Serve as a regulated cytoplasmic bridge for sharing of small molecules between cells.

questions.text: In a study, researchers were assessing the efficacy of the baroreceptor reflex in maintaining blood pressure homeostasis. A healthy volunteer undergoes a positional change from lying to standing, resulting in an initial drop in systolic blood pressure by 20 mm Hg. Subsequently, the baroreceptor reflex partially compensates, restoring 16 mm Hg. What is the gain of the baroreceptor system in this scenario?
Second messengers

options.label: A
options.text: Are substances that interact with first messengers outside cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Are substances that bind to first messengers in the cell membrane.

options.label: C
options.text: Are hormones secreted by cells in response to stimulation by another hormone.

options.label: D
options.text: Mediate the intracellular responses to many different hormones and neurotransmitters.

questions.correct_answer: D. Mediate the intracellular responses to many different hormones and neurotransmitters.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Mediate the intracellular responses to many different hormones and neurotransmitters.

questions.text: 30-year-old male the different body fluid compartments were measured. Which of the following can be used to measure his extracellular fluid volume?

In the experiment illustrated in part A of Figure 2, equal volumes of solutions X, Y, and Z are placed into the compartments of the two U-shaped vessels shown. The two compartments of each vessel are separated by semipermeable membranes (i.e., impermeable to ions and large polar molecules). Part B illustrates the fluid distribution across the membranes at equilibration. Assuming complete dissociation, identify each of the solutions shown.

options.label: A
options.text: Solution X: 1 M CaCl₂ | Solution Y: 1 M NaCl | Solution Z: 1 M glucose

options.label: B
options.text: Solution X: 1 M glucose | Solution Y: 1 M NaCl | Solution Z: 1 M CaCl₂

options.label: C
options.text: Solution X: 1 M NaCl | Solution Y: 2 M glucose | Solution Z: 3 M CaCl₂

options.label: D
options.text: Solution X: 2 M NaCl | Solution Y: 1 M NaCl | Solution Z: Pure water

questions.correct_answer: B. Solution X: 1 M glucose | Solution Y: 1 M NaCl | Solution Z: 1 M CaCl₂
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Solution X: 1 M glucose | Solution Y: 1 M NaCl | Solution Z: 1 M CaCl₂

questions.text: Which structure is lipophilic?

While studying the effect of varying the extracellular concentration on the transport rate of a substance, the graph below was obtained. This finding would suggest that this substance is transported by:

A 32-year-old male presents with acute onset of profuse watery diarrhea described as resembling “rice water” or rice gruel. He recently returned from a coastal region in South Asia. He appears dehydrated, and stool cultures are pending. The physician suspects a bacterial toxin that increases intestinal permeability. Which of the following cellular structures is most likely impaired, leading to the patient's symptoms?

Which of the following physiological processes is not correctly paired with a structure? Electrical transmission: gap junction Negative feedback inhibition: Renshaw cell Synaptic vesicle docking and fusion: presynaptic nerve terminal End plate potential: muscarinic cholinergic receptor Action potential generation: initial segment
In a given figure, at which labeled point on the action potential the absolute refractory period is located?
Which of the following types of stimuli produces only a local potential, but not an action potential?
Relaxation of muscle occurs by involving all of the following mechanisms except :

options.label: A
options.text: Hydrolysis of ATP in the myosin

options.label: B
options.text: Removal of Ca²⁺ from troponin C

options.label: C
options.text: Attachment of ATP to the myosin head

options.label: D
options.text: Active pumping of Ca²⁺ into the cisternae

questions.correct_answer: A. Hydrolysis of ATP in the myosin
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Hydrolysis of ATP in the myosin

questions.text: Identify the correct labeling (A, B, C, D respectively) in the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: Z line, A band, H zone, I Band

options.label: B
options.text: A band, Z line, H zone, M Band

options.label: C
options.text: A band, I Band, Z line, H zone

options.label: D
options.text: Z line, A band, M Band, H zone

questions.correct_answer: A. Z line, A band, H zone, I Band
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Z line, A band, H zone, I Band

questions.text: A 25-year-old man is participating in a study on skeletal muscle physiology. During muscle fiber stimulation, which of the following represents the correct sequence of events involved in excitation-contraction coupling in skeletal muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Generation of action potential → Neuromuscular junction activation → Calcium release → T-tubule activation → Contraction

options.label: B
options.text: Neuromuscular junction activation → Action potential in muscle fiber → T-tubule propagation → Calcium release from cisternae → Contraction

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium binds to actin → Action potential spreads → Calcium released → Neuromuscular stimulation → Muscle contracts

options.label: D
options.text: Action potential in T-tubule → Muscle contraction → Calcium movement → Action potential in cisternae → Relaxation

questions.correct_answer: B. Neuromuscular junction activation → Action potential in muscle fiber → T-tubule propagation → Calcium release from cisternae → Contraction
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Neuromuscular junction activation → Action potential in muscle fiber → T-tubule propagation → Calcium release from cisternae → Contraction

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding the Type I skeletal muscle fibers are correct except:

A 44 year male presented to the general medicine OPD with a history of muscle weakness in the lower limbs, difficulty in walking and severe fatigability. He was admitted and nerve conduction study was done. On repetitive motor nerve stimulation, the muscle strength was found to be increased. What would be the most probable diagnosis ?

When medical student were performing the amphibian experiments, they recorded a graph of a muscle contraction, in which latent period: 10ms, contraction period 40ms and relaxation period was 20ms. Calculate tetanizing frequency.

A 35-year-old man is undergoing a cardiovascular stress test. During exercise, his oxygen consumption increases significantly, leading to an enhanced cardiac output and redistribution of blood flow. Which of the following changes is least likely to occur in response to the increased metabolic demand?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased venous return due to muscle pump action

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased splanchnic blood flow due to sympathetic vasoconstriction

options.label: C
options.text: Increased coronary blood flow mediated by local metabolic vasodilation

options.label: D
options.text: Increased total peripheral resistance (TPR) due to widespread vasoconstriction

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased total peripheral resistance (TPR) due to widespread vasoconstriction
questions.explanation: Ans. D)  Increased total peripheral resistance (TPR) due to widespread vasoconstriction

questions.text: After a severe blood loss decrease in blood pressure is detected by _______________ in the common carotid arteries and leads to a _______________ reflex that stimulates an increase in the heart rate and force of contraction.
The ratio of stroke volume and arterial compliance approximately determines which of the following?

A 60-year-old woman has a resting heart rate of 70 beats per minute, arterial pressure of 130/85 mm Hg, and normal body temperature. Her pressure-volume diagram of the left ventricle is shown below. Based on the diagram, what is her cardiac output in milliliters per minute and When does the second heart sound occurs?
The phenomenon shown in the picture here can be best described as:
Regarding various cardiovascular reflexes, which of the following is incorrectly matched with its description?

options.label: A
options.text: Bezold-Jarisch Reflex – Bradycardia and hypotension due to stimulation of ventricular chemoreceptors; afferent and efferent limbs via vagus nerve.

options.label: B
options.text: Bainbridge Reflex – Bradycardia due to increased venous return, mediated by stretch receptors in the right atrium.

options.label: C
options.text: Cushing Reflex – Protective response to cerebral ischemia involving systemic hypertension and reflex bradycardia.

options.label: D
options.text: J Reflex – Bradycardia, hypotension, and apnea due to stimulation of juxta-pulmonary capillary (J) receptors.

questions.correct_answer: B. Bainbridge Reflex – Bradycardia due to increased venous return, mediated by stretch receptors in the right atrium.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Bainbridge Reflex – Bradycardia due to increased venous return, mediated by stretch receptors in the right atrium.

questions.text: In a 60-year-old male, the echocardiography revealed the end systolic volume to be 70 mL and the end diastolic volume to be 130 mL. If his cardiac output is 5L/min, what would be the stroke volume in this patient?
Left and right ventricular chambers work for systemic and pulmonary circulations respectively. Which one of the following characteristics is most similar in the systemic and pulmonary circulations?
All the following statements are incorrect about the Reynolds number, except?

options.label: A
options.text: The turbulence will decrease with increase in Reynolds number

options.label: B
options.text: The Reynolds number is inversely proportional to the velocity

options.label: C
options.text: The Reynolds number will be decreased when the radius is increased

options.label: D
options.text: The Reynolds number is inversely proportional to the viscosity

questions.correct_answer: D. The Reynolds number is inversely proportional to the viscosity
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The Reynold number is inversely proportional to the viscosity

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy has a severe asthmatic attack with wheezing. He experiences rapid breathing and becomes cyanotic. His arterial PO₂ is 60 mm Hg and his PCO₂ is 30 mm Hg. Which of the following statements about this patient is most likely to be true?

options.label: A
options.text: Forced expiratory volume/forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC) is increased

options.label: B
options.text: Ventilation/perfusion (V/Q) ratio is increased in the affected areas of his lungs

options.label: C
options.text: His arterial PCO₂ is higher than normal because of inadequate gas exchange

options.label: D
options.text: His arterial PCO₂ is lower than normal because hypoxemia is causing him to hyperventilate

questions.correct_answer: D. His arterial PCO₂ is lower than normal because hypoxemia is causing him to hyperventilate
questions.explanation: Ans. D) His arterial PCO₂ is lower than normal because hypoxemia is causing him to hyperventilate

questions.text: Hb dissociation curve shifts

options.label: A
options.text: To the right with CO poisoning

options.label: B
options.text: To the left with rise in temperature

options.label: C
options.text: To the left with a rise in pH

options.label: D
options.text: To the right with a decrease in 2,3 DPG

questions.correct_answer: C. To the left with a rise in pH
questions.explanation: Ans. C) To the left with a rise in pH

questions.text: Starling’s law of the heart

options.label: B
options.text: Explains the increase in heart rate produced by exercise.

options.label: C
options.text: Explains the increase in cardiac output that occurs when venous return is increased.

options.label: D
options.text: Explains the increase in cardiac output when the sympathetic nerves supplying the heart are stimulated.

questions.correct_answer: C. Explains the increase in cardiac output that occurs when venous return is increased.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Explains the increase in cardiac output that occurs when venous return is increased.

questions.text: A healthy, 25-year-old medical student participates in a 20-kilometer charity run for the Indian Medical Association. Which muscles does the student use (contract) during expiration?
questions.correct_answer: C. Internal intercostals and abdominal recti
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Internal intercostals and abdominal recti

questions.text: The following diagram shows the depth of respiration of a 45-year-old man who suffered a head injury in an automobile accident. This “crescendodecrescendo” pattern of breathing is called which of the following?
Stimulating the cephalic end of a vagus nerve would causes the respiration to:

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease in depth because of the lung stretch receptor reflex

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in rate because of the increased activity of the dorsal respiratory group

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in depth because of the increased sympathetic activity

questions.correct_answer: A. Decrease in depth because of the lung stretch receptor reflex
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Decrease in depth because of the lung stretch receptor reflex

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman is participating in a controlled metabolic study. Her oxygen consumption is measured at 300 mL/min, and her carbon dioxide output is recorded as 270 mL/min. What is the estimated respiratory quotient (RQ) in this individual?
Pulmonary compliance

options.label: B
options.text: Is defined as the change in pressure per unit change in volume.

options.label: C
options.text: Compliance is slightly greater when measured during deflation than when measured during inflation

questions.correct_answer: C. Compliance is slightly greater when measured during deflation than when measured during inflation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Compliance is slightly greater when measured during deflation than when measured during inflation

questions.text: A 45-year-old man inhaled as much air as possible and then expired with a maximum effort until no more air could be expired. This produced the maximum expiratory flow-volume curve shown in the following diagram. What is the forced vital capacity of this man (in litres)?
V/Q = infinity holds true in which of the following conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: Foreign body obstruction in the bronchus

options.label: C
options.text: When 02 and CO2 ratio is equal

options.label: D
options.text: The PO2 of alveolar air is 159 mmHg and PCO2 is 40 mmHg

questions.text: The forced vital capacity is

options.label: A
options.text: The amount of air that normally moves into (or out of) the lung with each respiration.

options.label: B
options.text: The amount of air that enters the lung but does not participate in gas exchange.

options.label: C
options.text: The amount of air expired after maximal expiratory effort.

options.label: D
options.text: The largest amount of gas that can be moved into and out of the lungs in 1 min.

questions.correct_answer: C. The amount of air expired after maximal expiratory effort.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The amount of air expired after maximal expiratory effort.

questions.text: The volume–pressure curves shown in the next diagram were obtained from a young, healthy subject and a patient. Which of the following best describes the condition of the patient?
For the eye to adapt to intense light, which of the following may occur?

options.label: A
options.text: Bipolar cells will continuously transmit signals at the maximum rate possible

options.label: B
options.text: Photochemical in both rods and cones will be reduced to retinal and opsins

options.label: C
options.text: There will be an increase in the size of the pupil

options.label: D
options.text: Vitamin A will convert into retinal

questions.correct_answer: B. Photochemical in both rods and cones will be reduced to retinal and opsins
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Photochemical in both rods and cones will be reduced to retinal and opsins

questions.text: The tactile discrimination will be affected in the lesion of this ascending sensory pathway of the spinal cord?
A lady presents with vascular injury to the inferior frontal gyrus. Which functional area is likely to be affected?

The morning after a rock concert, a 20-year-old college student notices difficulty hearing his professor during lecture. The physician at the Student Health Center suspects possible damage to his hair cells by the loud music. Depolarization of the hair cells in the cochlea is caused primarily by the flow of which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Cl– out of the hair cell

questions.correct_answer: A. K+ into the hair cell
questions.explanation: Ans. A) K+ into the hair cell

questions.text: A 57 year old patient recovers from COVID 19 infection, but still complains of no improvement in Smell and taste sensation. Bitter taste is mediated by action of

A 29-year-old man is brought to the emergency room after a traffic accident causing a traumatic brain injury. Within several hours he begins eating objects such as paper, is unable to maintain attention, and displays increased sexual activity. He is diagnosed with Klüver-Bucy syndrome. A diagnostic MRI is ordered to confirm bilateral lesions of which of the following regions of the brain?

In skin the somatosensory receptors work as a transducers, which convert various types of sensation into electrical energy and sent the signals to the brain. One of them is onion shaped corpuscles present in dermis. It detects which one of the following property?

Statement A: The deep and visceral pain are better localized compared to the superficial pain Statement B: There will be a deficiency of A delta fibers in the deep structures compared to superficial structures Which of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The statement A is true, the statement B is false

options.label: B
options.text: The statement A is false, the statement B is true

options.label: C
options.text: Both the statements A and B are true

options.label: D
options.text: Both the statements A and B are false

questions.correct_answer: B. The statement A is false, the statement B is true
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The statement A is false, the statement B is true

questions.text: A 72-year-old male is evaluated by a physiatrist after a stroke. The patient is observed to suffer from dysmetria, ataxia, and an intention tremor. These neurological signs are most likely related to a lesion within which of the following regions of the brain?
While studying the stimulus given at different time interval and their responses Pavlov performed various experiment on dogs, in Pavlov’s famous experiment the dog shows which of the following?

A 45-year-old patient visits a neurologist with a unique concern. The patient reports having difficulty recognizing familiar faces, including those of close family members and friends. This issue has been causing significant social discomfort. Which of the following conditions best describes the patient's symptoms?
All of the following can be seen in lower motor neuron lesions, except?
Identify the sleep wave marked in the EEG during sleep wake cycle?
In a patient with difficulty in storage of long-term memories after conversion from short term memories, which brain structure plays a crucial role in this process?

A 45-year-old male presents to the physician with significantly enlarged thyroid gland. Serum T3/T4 levels are decreased. lodine deficiency is suspected. Which of the following is the function of thyroid peroxidase in this patient?
Which of the following hormone is reported to promote maturation of hypothalamic gonadal axis during puberty?
In a child presenting with short stature, GH levels were found to be high but IGF-1 levels are low. Likely abnormality?

A 30-year-old female patient experiencing irregular menstrual cycles and seeking guidance from her healthcare provider. During the healthcare team explores factors influencing reproductive hormone regulation. Which of the following have a role in controlling the secretion of Prolactin?
Which of the following will decrease the secretion of insulin? Hypokalemia Acetylcholine Glucagon Fasting
During starvation, graph of three substances are plotted as below. The scale for A and B is on the left and the scale for C is on the right. Which of the substances are represented by the curve A?
Urticaria is seen in a patient. The DLC that was done will most probably show?
Which of the following hormones act via JAK- STAT pathway?

A 77-year-old man comes to the physician because of the swelling of his legs and feet for 6 months. Physical examination shows ascites and edema of the lower extremities. A decrease in which of the following most likely promotes edema formation in this patient?
Which of the following statement is true regarding the given cystometrogram?

options.label: A
options.text: Segment la is due to residual urine

options.label: B
options.text: Segment II is due to Laplace law

options.label: C
options.text: Micturition fails to happen in segment II

options.label: D
options.text: The dotted line represents that micturition has occurred

questions.correct_answer: B. Segment II is due to Laplace law
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Segment II is due to Laplace Law

questions.text: Which of the following is/are the component(s) of the counter current multiplier of the countercurrent system? Descending limb of the loop of Henle Thick ascending limb of Henle Thin ascending limb of Henle Vasa recta of the juxtamedullary nephron
If pH of the blood is 7.8 and PCO2 is 50 mmHg and HCO3 is 30 mMol/liter the most suitable statement is
questions.correct_answer: D. Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct formula for calculating the renal clearance rate (Cₛ) of a substance? Us​ = Urine concentration of the substance ; V = Urine flow rate Ps​ = Plasma concentration of the substance

A 56-year-old man with a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus presents to the clinic for a routine check-up. His medications include an ACE inhibitor and a diuretic which can affect the tubulo-glomerular feedback. Which one of the following is primarily regulated by the tubulo-glomerular feedback mechanism?

A newborn boy does not pass meconium within 48 hours of delivery. His abdomen is distended, and he begins vomiting. A suction biopsy of a distally narrowed segment of the colon shows a lack of ganglionic nerve cells. The most probable diagnosis in this newborn is
A young man met with a motor bike accident and had injury to ileum and jejunum. Therefore the entire ileum and partial jejunum was resected. Which of the following would the patient suffer from?

A 68-year-old woman with hematemesis has heart- burn and stomach pain. An endoscopy shows inflammation involving the gastric body and antrum as well as a small gastric ulcer. Biopsies were positive for H. pylori. H. pylori damages the gastric mucosa primarily by increasing mucosal levels of which of the following?
Which of the following are secreted from the parietal cells of the stomach? Mucous Hydrochloric acid Gastrin Intrinsic factor

A guinea-pig is dissected and a portion of its intestine is fixed in the modified Dales chamber to study the effects of some drugs on intestinal contractility. A substance X was infused in the broth following which the graph comes out as depicted. Substance X most closely resembles which of these substances?
Maximum area in homunculus signifies which one of the following?

A 40-year-old patient undergoing evaluation for a suspected catecholamine-secreting tumor The healthcare team, into a comprehensive discussion on the principal metabolite resulting from norepinephrine metabolism and subsequently excreted in urine and the clinical implications of measuring this metabolite in the context of diagnosing and managing catecholamine-secreting tumors. The metabolite is
Which of the following is the incorrect match?

options.label: A
options.text: Gastrin from G cells from stomach

options.label: B
options.text: GIP from L cells from duodenum and jejunum

options.label: C
options.text: Secretin from S cells of duodenum and jejunum

options.label: D
options.text: CCK from I cell of duodenum and pancreas

questions.correct_answer: B. GIP from L cells from duodenum and jejunum
questions.explanation: Ans. B) GIP from L cells from duodenum and jejunum
